SNACKS.COLLIDING_FILE: The coclustering model was built using data with both Ansi and Utf8 encodings. The display may be corrupted and not fully correspond to the model
SNACKS.TOO_MANY_VARIABLES: Too many variables. Only the 1000 high levels are displayed.
SNACKS.UNFOLDED_DATAS_MAXIMUM_UNFOLD: Auto-unfold is limited to {{count}} for performance purpose
SNACKS.UNFOLDED_DATAS_PERFORMANCE_WARNING: Displayed datas have been automatically unfolded to {{count}} clusters

NO_DATAS.WELCOME: Open a file from the menu
NO_DATAS.OPEN_COMPOSITION_VIEW_TO_DISPLAY_EXTERNA: Open composition view to display external datas
NO_DATAS.NO_COMPOSITION_FOR_NUMERICAL: No composition datas for numerical dimensions
NO_DATAS.NO_EXTERNAL_DATAS_FOR_NUMERICAL: No external datas for numerical dimensions

SETTINGS.CLEAR_DATA_INSTRUCTIONS: Delete local cache in case of minor problem

COOKIE_CONSENT.TITLE: Cookies consent
COOKIE_CONSENT.MESSAGE: Allow this application to use cookies for usage statistics purposes only?

GLOBAL.TOO_MANY_VALUES: Too many values. Only the 200 first are displayed.
GLOBAL.ENABLE_BETA_VERSIONS: Are you sure to enable Beta versions ?
GLOBAL.BETA_VERSIONS_WARNING: Warning: Beta versions are not stable and may contain bugs.
GLOBAL.BIG_FILES_LOADING_WARNING: Loading very large reports may take more than a minute ...
GLOBAL.LOAD_FILE_FROM_MENU: or load a file from menu
GLOBAL.NAME: Name
GLOBAL.MANAGE_VIEWS_DESC: Add or remove different views on each dimension
GLOBAL.SAVE_BEFORE_QUIT: Do you want to save the changes you made?

TABS.PROJECT: Project: list of output analysis files
TABS.PREPARATION: Preparation:  univariate data analysis on the train database
TABS.EVALUATION: Evaluation: evaluation of the predictors on databases (train, test and others)
TABS.CONTEXT: cCntextual dimensions of the coclustering (if more than 2 dimensions)

COMMONS.LEVEL_DISTRIBUTION: display the level distribution of the variables
COMMONS.MATRIX_CONTRAST: The contrast allows to highlight the interesting patterns
COMMONS.MATRIX_GLOBAL_LOCAL: The scale is local when the patterns are scaled according to their local context, and global when their are scaled w.r.t. the entire dataset

DISTRIBUTION.TITLE: Distribution of selected variable groups or intervals

PURITY.TITLE: Purity is defined as the entropy of the distribution of classes

VARIABLES.TITLE: List of variables used by SNB model
VARIABLES.NAME: Name of the variable
VARIABLES.LEVEL: Evaluation of the predictive importance of the variable. The Level is a value between 0 (variable without predictive interest) and 1 (variable with optimal predictive importance).
VARIABLES.WEIGHT: Evaluation of the predictive importance of the variable taken relatively all the variables used by the predictor.
VARIABLES.IMPORTANCE: Variable used in the best predictor

VARIABLES.TITLE:
Univariate data analysis results
Right click on a column title to get new columns
VARIABLES.TYPE:
Type of the variable :
	 Cat for Categorical 
	 Num for Numerical
VARIABLES.RANK: Rank of the variable, sorted by decreasing Level
VARIABLES.NAME: Name of the variable
VARIABLES.LEVEL: Evaluation of the predictive importance of the variable. The Level is a value between 0 (variable without predictive interest) and 1 (variable with optimal predictive importance).
VARIABLES.PARTS: Number of parts resulting from the grouping preprocessing of the variable.
VARIABLES.VALUES: Number of initial values of the variable.

INTERVAL.TITLE: Value list of selected variable group

TARGET_DISTRIBUTION.TITLE: Target distribution according to group or interval

REG_MATRIX.TITLE: 2D chart of selected dimension according selected variable and target variable

TYPES.TITLE: Tab of evaluation report
TYPES.TYPE: Type of dataset use to performe evaluation
TYPES.NAME: Name of dictionary of dataset

EVALUATIONS.TITLE: Tab of all evaluation results
EVALUATIONS.NAME: Name of evaluated model
EVALUATIONS.TYPE: Type of dataset use to performe evaluation
EVALUATIONS.AUC: Area under the ROC curve (AUC); evaluates the ordering of the predicted scores per target value.
EVALUATIONS.COMPRESSION: Evaluates the predicted target probabilities using a negative log likelihood approach and is normalized (between 0 and 1) using the baseline predictor.
EVALUATIONS.ACCURACY: Evaluates the proportion of correct prediction
EVALUATIONS.GINI: GINI Index : evaluates the ordering of the predicted scores for all targets. Gini coefficient is closely related to AUC GINI = 2 * AUC -1. Value 0 means a random model and value 1 means Perfect Model.
EVALUATIONS.ROBUSTNESS: Evaluation of the model overfitting. The closest to 1 the value, the smallest the overfitting.
EVALUATIONS.RMSE: Root mean square error between the predicted value and the actual value
EVALUATIONS.RANKRMSE: Root mean square error between the predicted value rank and the actual value rank
EVALUATIONS.RANKMAE: Mean average error in the rank domain
EVALUATIONS.RANKNLPD: Negative log predictive density in the rank domain

GAIN_CHART.TITLE: The cumulative gain chart plots the fraction of actual correct prediction on the y-axis for each fraction of the dataset on the-x-axis, when the dataset is sorted by decreasing predicted probability of the main target value.
GAIN_CHART.SELECT: Choose target values to display on chart

REC_CURVE.TITLE: Regression Error Characteristics curve plot the error tolerance on the x-axis versus the percentage of points predicted within the tolerance on the y-axis.

CONFUSION_MATRIX.TITLE: The confusion matrix allows to compare the predicted values and the actual values.

VARIABLES.TITLE: Pair variables
VARIABLES.RANK: Rank of the pair of variables, sorted by decreasing importance.
VARIABLES.NAME1: Name of the first variable in the pair
VARIABLES.NAME2: Name of the second variable in the pair
VARIABLES.LEVEL: Evaluation of the total predictive importance of the pair of variables. The Level is a value between 0 (variable without predictive interest) and 1 (variable with optimal predictive importance).
VARIABLES.LEVEL1: Recalls the univariate predictive importance of the first variable
VARIABLES.LEVEL2: Recalls the univariate predictive importance of the second variable
VARIABLES.VARIABLES:
Number of active variables in the pair: 
 0: there is no information in the pair 
 1: the information in the pair reduces to the information in one variable 
 2: the two variables are jointly informative
VARIABLES.PARTS1: Number of intervals or groups of values in the first variable
VARIABLES.PARTS2: Number of intervals or groups of values in the second variable
VARIABLES.CELLS: Number of non-empty cells in the data grid resulting from the cross-product of the two univariate partitions
VARIABLES.DELTALEVEL:
Evaluation of the relative predictive contribution of the pair of variables. 
 Contribution =[level-max(level1,level2))/[level-min(level1-level2)] 
 The DeltaLevel is strictly positive if and only if the variable pair is informative, that is if it brings more information than both variables taken individually.

COOCURENCE_MATRIX.TITLE: 2D chart of selected dimension according variables

REGRESSION_MATRIX.TITLE: 2D chart of selected dimension according variables

TARGET_DISTRIBUTION.TITLE: Target distribution according selected cell of matrix

CELLS.TITLE: List of cells
CELLS.LESS: percentage of the $less$ target value in the cell
CELLS.MORE: percentage of the $more$ target value in the cell

MATRIX.CELL_STATS_FREQUENCY: Frequency : number of occurences in the selected co-cluster
MATRIX.CELL_STATS_EXPECTED_FREQUENCY: Expected frequency in case of independence of the two dimensions

DIMENSION.SELECT: Select the dimension to display here
DIMENSION.STATISTICS: This view shows the cluster hierarchy. It allows to navigate and to modify the hierarchy of clusters. The hierarchy is presented like a file manager, each directory being a cluster. By opening or closing a cluster, you can choose the appropriate hierarchy.

CURRENT_CLUSTERS.TITLE: This table is a flat view of the hierarchy. Each line of the table contains a terminal or a fold cluster.
CURRENT_CLUSTERS.NAME: Terminal cluster in the current hierarchy
CURRENT_CLUSTERS.FATHER: Father cluster of the current cluster
CURRENT_CLUSTERS.FREQUENCY: Number of items belonging to the current cluster
CURRENT_CLUSTERS.INTEREST: The “Interest” of a cluster is a value between 0 and 1: clusters with a interest close to 1 are the most informative
CURRENT_CLUSTERS.HIERARCHICAL_LEVEL: Normalized measure between 0 (all is folded) and 1 (all is unfolded); it represents the information kept for the current unfolding of the hierarchy and can be interpreted as a distance to the root cluster
CURRENT_CLUSTERS.SIZE: The number of different items that belong to this cluster
CURRENT_CLUSTERS.RANK: The column “Rank” provides the ordering of the clusters in the hierarchy view.

COMPOSITION.TITLE: This view presents all value items which are grouped in the cluster currently selected
COMPOSITION.CLUSTER: The column “Cluster” contains the cluster visible in the hierarchy that contains the item.
COMPOSITION.TERMINAL_CLUSTER: Contain the terminal cluster that owns this item
COMPOSITION.RANK: The column “Rank” provides the  ordering of the items in the hierarchy view.
COMPOSITION.TYPICALITY: Interest measure of the value within its cluster, between 0 (least representative) and 1 (most representative)
COMPOSITION.FREQUENCY: The “Frequency” of an item is its number of occurrences in the cluster

EXTERNAL_DATAS.TITLE: Integrate external data associated to each cluster element. The selection of an item in the composition view display the corresponding data in this view. There are 3 types of data fields: textual, numerical and categorical. The display is optimized according to the data type. Several fields can be associated for each item.

ANNOTATION.TITLE: Simple text box that allows annotating each cluster

DISTRIBUTION.TITLE: Histogram of the distribution of a dimension on the selected cluster of the other dimension

SELECTED_CLUSTERS.TITLE: Global view of the state of the coclustering at the current level of unfolding
SELECTED_CLUSTERS.NAME: Dimensions of the coclustering
SELECTED_CLUSTERS.NB_CLUSTERS: Number of clusters on each dimension for the current unfolding

UNFOLD_HIERARCHY.INFO_RATE_CHART: The evolution of the information according to the number of clusters: the percentage of information kept at each granularity of the hierarchy
UNFOLD_HIERARCHY.LEGEND: Click on dimension to highlight data
